meanings.definition: To place before or in front of something else.
meanings.sent1: She preposes her favorite book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The teacher preposes the new vocabulary words before the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The cat preposes its toy mouse in front of the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent4: The early morning sunlight preposes a golden glow over the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The chef preposes the garnish beautifully on top of the dish.

meanings.definition: To present or introduce something before something else.
meanings.sent1: He preposes his argument before the meeting starts.
meanings.sent2: The magician preposes the trick to the audience before performing it.
meanings.sent3: The child preposes the punchline of the joke, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist preposes the sketch before adding colors to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The singer preposes the chorus to build anticipation in the song.

meanings.definition: To prioritize or give precedence to something.
meanings.sent1: The safety of the passengers preposes over everything else for the pilot.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, health preposes above all other concerns.
meanings.sent3: The student preposes studying for the exam over going to the party.
meanings.sent4: Kindness preposes in importance when dealing with others.
meanings.sent5: The team preposes teamwork and collaboration for success.
